source.38b52484:
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

selected_country_1 = 'France'
selected_country_2 = 'France'

df1 = pd.read_csv('../input/covid19-global-dataset/worldometer_coronavirus_daily_data.csv',header=0)
df1 = df1[df1['country']==selected_country_1]
df2 = pd.read_csv('../input/covid-world-vaccination-progress/country_vaccinations.csv',header=0)
df2 = df2[df2['country']==selected_country_1]
df1.index = pd.to_datetime(df1['date'])
df2.index = pd.to_datetime(df2['date'])
source.05b74ad5:
from plotly.offline import iplot
import plotly.graph_objs as go

daily_new_cases = go.Scatter(x=df1.index,y=df1['daily_new_cases'],yaxis='y1',name='Daily confirmed cases')
daily_vaccinations = go.Scatter(x=df2.index,y=df2['daily_vaccinations'],yaxis='y2',name='Daily vaccinations')

layout_obj = go.Layout(title = 'COVID vs Vaccines',xaxis=dict(title='Date'),yaxis=dict(title='Daily Cases'),yaxis2=dict(title='Vaccinations',side='right',overlaying ='y'))
fig = go.Figure(data=[daily_new_cases,daily_vaccinations],layout = layout_obj)
iplot(fig)
fig.write_html('outcome.html')
source.1890cf98:
country = 'France'
df3 = pd.read_csv('../input/covid19-global-dataset/worldometer_coronavirus_daily_data.csv',header=0)
df3 = df3.groupby('country').sum()['daily_new_cases'].sort_values(ascending=False)[0:10]
df3 = df3.reset_index()
df3.index = df3.index + 1
index1 = df3.loc[df3['country']==country]
print('The global ranking of',country, 'of the total cases is:')
print(index1)

df4 = pd.read_csv('../input/covid-world-vaccination-progress/country_vaccinations.csv',header=0)
df4 = df4.groupby('country').max()['people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred'].sort_values(ascending=False)
df4 = df4.reset_index()
df4.index = df4.index + 1
index2 = df4.loc[df4['country']==country]
print('The global ranking of',country, 'of the total vaccinations per number of hundred people is:')
print(index2)

print(df3)
print(df4)

source.0720c68c:
# Summary:

* Currently, the global ranking of France of the total cases is 4th and global ranking of France of the total vaccinations per number of hundred people is 53th.
* The total Covid cases of France is 5.881.125 cases, in which the highest number cases per day is 88.79k cases in Nov. 7 2020, then decreasing after that. The increasing significanly is coming after June 2020 (when easing of restrictions is conducted).
(Source: https://www.france24.com/en/20200528-live-french-pm-philippe-unveils-second-phase-in-lifting-of-covid-19-lockdown)
* From begining of December, the daily cases continuosly increase again when travel restrictions is stop.
(Source: https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/415411/france-authorities-ease-domestic-covid-19-restrictions-dec-15-update-23). 
* In paralel, the vaccinations is started from end of December until now. It is take 3 months after the vaccination, the number of affections case starts to decreasing until now. The number of people fully vaccinated per hundred is 13.77. 
* The decreasing of Covid cases is the result of both vaccinations and the state of emergency. 
* From 15th May 2021, restaurant terraces and cultural centres are set to open, and the curfew is to be extended to 21:00. From June 9, the curfew will be 23:00. France is step by step to easing the restrictions. I think it is interesting to see the result in June and July this year to confirm if the vaccinations effect when the restrictions is lifted. (Source: 
https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/France-deconfinement-What-is-opening-from-May-19-this-week-Restaurant-terraces-cinemas-museums-theatres.
https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/Coronavirus-Daily-updates-on-the-situation-in-France)
